page.title: 06Re-development of a house.
page.content:
Huskards is a large and impressive house in Fryerning. It was originally built in the eighteenth century with later additions. It's grounds were once far more extensive than they are today; there is evidence of a small moat. The house served at one stage this century as an old peoples home and was once destroyed by fire.
With few people wealthy enough to undertake the rebuilding of the house for single family occupancy a building firm converted the house into six luxury apartments while maintaining the external character of the property.
A typical apartment consists of a lounge, dining room, kitchen, three large bedrooms and two bathrooms.
